definition: to walk (side part of split character)
to lose consciousness/to be in a coma/stupor/coma/stunned/disoriented
to be engrossed/to be absorbed with/to lose oneself in/to be addicted to
superstition/to have a superstitious belief (in sth)
to be infatuated with/to be enchanted by/to be passionate about

sentences.english: I didn't like the film much but my boyfriend went into raptures about it.
sentences.chinese: 我不太喜歡那部電影，但我的男朋友卻對它了迷。

sentences.english: Lutetia has been a mystery for many years.
sentences.chinese: 小行星Lutetia許多年來一直是個迷。

sentences.english: So, have you gotten lost in London?
sentences.chinese: 那麼，你在倫敦迷過路嗎？

sentences.english: It is very often nothing but our own vanity that deceives us.
sentences.chinese: 我們往往會因爲我們自己的虛榮心，而給弄迷了心竅。

sentences.english: I was a huge Star Wars fan as well — but Close Encounters, I love.
sentences.chinese: 我也是個星戰迷，不過最愛的是《第三類接觸》。
我是個地地道道的羽毛球迷。

sentences.english: It's still such a mystery to me, the act of falling asleep.
sentences.chinese: 如何墜入黑甜鄉對我來說仍是一個迷。

sentences.english: Evidently a furry is someone who is an enthusiast of science fiction and fantasy where the heroes are animals.
sentences.chinese: 毛茸茸的人是當然是指科幻迷啦。

sentences.english: Meet Wang Yu and Li Lintao, a pair ofgearheads living and working in Beijing, China.
sentences.chinese: 來會會王宇和李林濤，這是一對生活在北京的機械迷。

sentences.english: An enthusiast dressed as a warrior pretends to be slain.
sentences.chinese: 一個戰士裝扮的“黑斯廷斯戰役”迷假裝戰死。

sentences.english: Xiao Ming is suddenly obsessed with weapons, he is especially interested in anti-ballistic missiles.
sentences.chinese: 小明忽然成了兵器迷，尤其對反彈道導彈很有興趣。

sentences.english: It is the eternal mystery, the bottomless pit, the black hole.
sentences.chinese: 黑色是一個永恆的迷，無底坑，黑洞。

sentences.english: Eddie is ecstatic over his new train set.
sentences.chinese: 埃迪對他的新玩具火車着了迷。

sentences.english: For the habituated flower addict, some kind of flower-fix is urgently needed.
sentences.chinese: 對於花卉迷來說，一些花朵的修復是他們迫切需要的。

sentences.english: I was crazy about the stars, and pestered my father into buying me a telescope.
sentences.chinese: 我對星星着了迷，吵着要我爸爸買一架望遠鏡。
那麼你是一個巧克力迷。

definition: lit. spirit and soul upside down (idiom); infatuated and head over heels in love/fascinated/captivated
see 謎兒|谜儿[mei4 r5], riddle
to be engrossed/to be absorbed with/to lose oneself in/to be addicted to
to be infatuated with/to be enchanted by/to be passionate about
powder/cosmetic face powder/food prepared from starch/noodles or pasta made from any kind of flour/whitewash/white/pink
dream/CL:場|场[chang2],個|个[ge4]/(bound form) to dream
lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/fig. intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth
